title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
1. Open WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Observe that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu.
5. Select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer.
6. Verify that a warning or question message box is displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
